abstract: On "Face the Nation," Bob Schieffer, who blames tobacco for his past bout with cancer, takes issue with the Cain campaign.
snippet: On "Face the Nation," Bob Schieffer, who blames tobacco for his past bout with cancer, takes issue with the Cain campaign.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON - Had Herman Cain known he would be running into a human buzzsaw named Bob Schieffer on Sunday, he might have had second thoughts about including a now infamous scene at the end of his new campaign video that shows his chief of staff, Mark Block, coolly smoking a cigarette.

headline.main: Cain Gets Tough Treatment for Video's Cigarette Scene
